lead_paragraph: Fewer than 200 people live in the Chilean outpost, which was founded in 1984, when Chile was seeking to bolster its claims in Antarctica.

byline.contributor: Pascale Bonnefoy contributed reporting from Santiago, Chile.

headline.print_headline: Long Nights and No Dogs Allowed for Chilean Families Settling in Antarctica
headline.main: Antarctic Life: No Dogs, Few Vegetables and ‘a Little Intense’ in the Winter

snippet: Fewer than 200 people live in the Chilean outpost, which was founded in 1984, when Chile was seeking to bolster its claims in Antarctica.
abstract: Villa Las Estrellas Journal; Chilean village located in Antarctica is rare civilian settlement on continent where most nations send only researchers; outpost was founded as part of territorial rivalry with neighboring Argentina; residents of Villa Las Estrellas relish novelty of region's culture, climate and geography.
